intro: Cissampelos macrosepala, commonly known as the large-sepal cissampelos, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
